ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.2.10, 'Quartetto no. 4...' and 22.5.6, 'Quartetto no. 5... per uso di S. E. Abbate Don Antonio Giorgio'

first_edition: (c. 1775), London, Brenner: Op. 6 no. 3 (for title, see No. 166)
(c. 1780), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 2 no. 3 (for title, see No. 166)
(c. 1785), Paris, Boyer-Naderman: Op. 6 no. 3 (for title, see No. 165)
sources.modern_edition: 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 6 no. 3 (pocket score; revised by Enrico Polo). The movements are in a different order: Largo—Minuetto—Allegro

arrangements: (A) Of the second movement, as part of a sonata for harpsichord (or pianoforte) and violin, by 'Mlle Le Jeune', c. 1785 (see No. 48)
(B) Of the second movement, as part of a quartet (no. 1) for clarinet, flute, horn and bassoon, by O. Van den Broek, c. 1820 (see No. 263)
